metadata.title: The Argentine Society of Laparoscopic Surgery (SACIL) letter on Covid-19

body_text.text: Argentina does not escape the current world crisis, due to the pandemic that caused the outbreak of the coronavirus COVID-19. We are astonished at the speed in the worsening of the epidemiological situation at the international level, the incredible transmission capacity and its unpredictable repercussion.

The Argentine Society of Laparoscopic Surgery (SACIL), through its Board of Directors, has elaborated norms not only for “the medical act” but also to direct the care and protection of our surgeons, operating room personnel and patients. We have resorted to the use of virtual tools to avoid interruption of our continuing medical education and board meetings.

We have conducted a comprehensive analysis and evaluation of the available reported protocols and guidelines in our country and international. Some of the Organizations reviewed include but are not limited to our National, Provincial and Municipal Public Health reports, as well as the guidelines provided by our Argentine Societies: Surgery (AAC) - Anesthesiology (FAAAAR) – Infectious disease- (SADI) - Gynecological Oncology (AAGO) and Reproductive Medicine (SAMER) and those of the various International organizations: American Society of Laparoscopic Gynecology (AAGL) - American College of Surgeons (ACS) - International Society of Gynecological Oncology (IGCS)- Spanish Surgical Society (AEC).

As a result, we adhere to the globally provided recommendations (subject to continuous review) and advise to our health care personal:1)Guidelines on elective surgery:•Elective surgeries are suspended. We are evaluating the continuity of this recommendation•Emergency surgeries are performed according to medical criteria.•Oncological surgeries are prioritized, according to medical criteria (weight COVID-19 mortality against oncological mortality, especially in high-risk patients)
2)Guidelines on the use of PPE during surgery:•They are used in cases of Coronavirus COVID-19 Positive or Suspicious•They are not used in cases of coronavirus COVID-19 Negatives
3)Guidelines on the surgical approach: Laparoscopic vs Laparotomic:•We believe that we should not modify our preferred surgical approach and technique, as it would be safer to the patient and team to not modify them. These should be based on a medical criterion, including patients with surgical emergencies and SARS-CoV-2 infection.-COVID-19 Negative Case: laparoscopy (Specialist surgeon – PPE 2- Non- COVID Operating Room)-COVID-19 Positive Case: Laparoscopy (Expert Surgeon -PPE 3- COVID Operating room

4)Guidelines for vaginal and hysteroscopic surgery:•If a vaginal and/or hysteroscopic approach is required, the same recommendations as for the abdominal approach.
